comments.author: Kevin
comments.body: The Man is infringing on my lunch. Meetings at 11:00 and 1:00 mean I'm office-bound. I'll try to get out after work and not become a total sloth.

comments.author: Greg
comments.body: That guy descending Flagstaff is on his breaks too much. -Greg

comments.author: Greg
comments.body: He's also using his brakes too much.

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Only Greg would say that... He's he only guy I know w/ cobwebs on his brake levers. He's not reckless; he's simply conserving his brakes for future generations. "And these were my great-grandpa's brake pads!" "Cool! It doesn't look like he ever used 'em! Can I hold them?" PS, I see my surgeon next Wednesday. (She's doing a demo at Home Depot, so I won't have to drive all the way back down to the Aurora VoTech again. Nice.) I'm assuming she'll tell me it's okay to resume biking. And I'm assuming she's building a conservative cushion into her timeline, because I'm assuming she's assuming I'm too obtuse to grasp the idea of gradual, managed recovery and healing... So look for me back on wheels Monday. Can hardly wait!

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: Does anyone have a camera Greg can borrow for the hi-speed version of the Flag descent?

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Re: the camera for Greg's descent... Not one of ours! They don't have those little space shuttle tiles on them. No way!
